snippet: Vice President Nicolás Maduro said on national television that the government was monitoring Henrique Capriles Radonski while he was on a trip to New York and Miami.
abstract: Venezuelan Vice President Nicolas Maduro says on national television that the government is monitoring prominent opposition politician Henrique Capriles Radonski while he is on a trip to New York and Miami; Capriles is likely to represent opposition while Maduro is expected to run as government candidate if special election is needed to replace ailing Pres Hugo Chavez.

byline.contributor: Colin Moynihan contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Vice President Nicolás Maduro said on national television that the government was monitoring Henrique Capriles Radonski while he was on a trip to New York and Miami.

headline.seo: Venezuela Says It’s Tracking Opposition Leader in U.S.
headline.main: Venezuela Says It’s Tracking Opposition Leader in U.S.
headline.print_headline: Venezuela Says It’s Tracking Opposition Leader in U.S.
